Pre-workout Supplements

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎08-03-2012 03:57 PM

I am a 6 year diabetic, and I'm big into working out.  Currently, I take a protein supplement (ON Gold Standard 100% whey) after each workout.  I was interested in possibly starting to take a pre-workout supplement and/or creatine.  Many of my friends (non-diabetics) take MusclePharm's Assault pre-workout.  They have also recommended simply taking creatine.  Are either of these safe for me to take?  I have put a link to the MusclePharm Assault product and to MP's creatine product below:

 

Assault:       http://www.musclepharm.com/products/assault

 

Creatine:     http://www.gnc.com/product/index.jsp?productId=11821589

 

Thanks for your help!

Re: Pre-workout Supplements

Options

‎08-06-2012 11:01 PM

You didn't say what your workout is or how intense it is.  My workouts vary in time and intensity an my pre- and post-fueling is different depending on the workout.  I also like taking whey protein after a workout to help rebuild muscle.  For longer workouts ... say a 3,4 or 5 hour bike ride, I'll take a recovery drink that has carbs as well as protein.  Most sports nutritionists will suggest a 3 or 4:1 carb: protein ratio.  I mix it to 1:1.

 

Pre-workout meals will also vary.  You need carbs to fuel your muscles.  However, your liver will produce enough glycogen for a pretty good 1 or maybe 2 hour workout.  Usually for anything more than a 1 hour bike ride I'll fuel with carbs as I ride.  Everyone is different so you have to experiment with what works for you.  I don't like the idea of taking creatine but that's me and not a suggestion for you.

 

 

Ed Tepper
Athlete/Member
Team Novo Nordisk www.teamnovonordisk.com
Personal Blog: www.cycling2live.com
Facebook: www.facebook.com/cycling2live
Opinions are mine and not of my team or any of its sponsors.

‎08-30-2012 10:14 AM

The main thing to consider is whether the pre-workout has sugar or glucose in it.  I take a pre-workout supplement and make sure it has little or no sugar in it.  Another thing to consider is stimulant or no stimulant.  If you are sensitive to stimulants, you should stick with non-stimulant pre-workouts.  I like MP Assault and have had good results with it.  I've tried heavy stim pre-workouts and had some adverse effects so, I stay away from heavy stim pre-workouts.  MP Assault has caffeine in it.

‎03-17-2013 03:46 PM

I think you guys might've misread what I was asking, but no worries though... What i was hoping to get dome insight onI was whether or not pre-workouts are safe for type 1 diabetics. And I don't care as much about the sugar and stuff because I can control that with insulin and whatnot, but i care more so on the interaction between insulin and creatine/bcaas/any other ingredients that might be found in a pre workout supplement. I just didn't want to take something that wasn't safe in terms of insulin-supplement interaction.

‎04-02-2013 06:27 PM

I eat whey protein isolate.  I found out I could save about $60 by buying it at my local grocery store out of their bulk food bins-- where they sell the bulk flour, bulk cereal, bulk nuts, etc.  

 

It's the same ingredient found in the body building whey protein mixes, but a whole lot cheaper.

 

Just thought I would throw that out there to anyone who was stunned by the price of whey protein at the health food stores.

.

‎09-08-2013 06:57 PM

I know this was posted a long time ago, but I was searching to see what other T1D athletes take. I have only ever taken Assault (over a year now). Not really much sugar in it but the caffeine, along with very intense workouts can drive my BGs into the 300s. I definitely notice a difference but probably not as big of a difference than non-T1Ds. Obviously my creatine levels are higher when I am on it. I cycle on and off of it.

‎10-30-2013 07:18 PM

Hi, I have taken C4 from Cellucore, Jack3d (old version), Muscelpharm assault, I am trying a new preworkout from GNC right now..Amplified N.O. Loaded V2. I liked al of them besides Assault. Assault spiked my sugar something crazy.

 

I also take MuscleMilk protien 56 grams 2x's daily.

GNC Mens Sport multivitamin.

 

in early 2013 i tried putting on some weight. Started at 165lbs. Using the above protien amount i gained 22lbs in 3 months. Mostly gained muscle mass in my back, legs, chest, arms. Gained a little midsection weight as well which i was able to loose rather quickly when i dropped to 56 grams protien a day, 2 shakes at 23 grams each. Hope this helps.
